00:00:02:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:02:050000.Dialogue: Completely empty box. If you'd like to examine it...

00:00:05:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:05:130000.Dialogue: Mm-hmm. Yep. I see nothing in this box but a wasted childhood.

00:00:15:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:15:160000.Dialogue: And we have this completely ordinary cylinder. If you'd like to examine it...

00:00:21:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:21:080000.Dialogue: Ordinary, yet I sense it is dripping with magical potential.

00:00:26:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:26:150000.Dialogue: Oh, dear Lord. A man pops out for a moment to evacuate his bowels and catch up on the adventures of the Caped Crusader, only to emerge and discover his apartment has been transformed into a cabaret.

00:00:40:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:40:100000.Dialogue: Sheldon, he's just practicing for his cousin's birthday party.

00:00:44:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:44:090000.Dialogue: As I was saying... empty box, empty cylinder, and... ooh! Voila.

00:00:52:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:52:010000.Dialogue: I'm telling you, dude, there's a seat on the Hogwarts Express with your name on it.

00:00:57:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:57:080000.Dialogue: This is how you're going to entertain your little cousin and his friends? By lying to them?

00:01:03:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:03:230000.Dialogue: A magic show is an inherently deceitful proposition. This is an ordinary top hat. You've chosen that card freely. I do not have a set of lock picks lodged in my keister.

00:01:14:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:14:230000.Dialogue: Can't you just enjoy the wonder, Sheldon? Why must you peek behind the curtain? Or up the butt?

00:01:21:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:21:010000.Dialogue: If we poison the critical thinking faculties of children by telling them that rabbits come out of hats, then we create adults who believe in astrology and homeopathy and that Ryan Reynolds was a better choice for Green Lantern than lovable rogue Nathan Fillion.

00:01:36:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:36:200000.Dialogue: Sheldon, he's just gonna do a few magic tricks for some kids. I really don't think they're gonna end up liking the Green Lantern movie.

00:01:45:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:45:100000.Dialogue: Don't be so hard on him. It's natural to be a little cranky when you have... a quarter in your ear!

00:01:54:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:54:020000.Dialogue: Coins lodged in body parts is not a source of amusement. When I was five, Billy Sparks put a Mexican peso up my nose.

00:02:07:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:07:210000.Dialogue: Takes me 45 minutes to get through airport security.

00:02:14:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:14:090000.Dialogue: Look, I made Sheldon disappear. Ta-da.

00:02:17:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:17:230000.Dialogue: Next time, you should open with that.

00:02:47:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:47:100000.Dialogue: Ooh, look who's out on a date. Pasadena's favorite power couple, Shamy.

00:02:53:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:53:030000.Dialogue: And that is the answer to the question, what is wrong with eating at The Cheesecake Factory?

00:02:57:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:57:200000.Dialogue: So, are we celebrating anything special tonight?

00:03:00:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:00:170000.Dialogue: Oh, yes. Our relationship agreement specifies that the second Thursday of every month, or the third Thursday in a month with five Thursdays, is date night.

00:03:17:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:17:050000.Dialogue: All right, without objection, the minutes of the previous date are considered read and agreed to.

00:03:28:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:28:080000.Dialogue: Superb. This morning I made a palindrome with my Alpha-Bits. Nice hat, Bob Tahecin.

00:03:36:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:36:230000.Dialogue: Sounds like you hit the ground running. I have a bit of good news myself. My most recent paper on how a cooperative long-term potentiation can map memory sequences in dendritic branches made the cover of Neuron.

00:03:50:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:50:170000.Dialogue: Ooh! Speaking of good news, somebody... just hit 100 Twitter followers.

00:03:57:050000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:57:050000.Dialogue: That's nice. Anyway, I've been dreaming of this day for a long time.

00:04:01:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:01:010000.Dialogue: Yeah, me, too. Triple digits, I'm not gonna lie-- it feels pretty good.

00:04:06:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:04:06:010000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I'm the sole author on a paper being published in a distinguished journal that may change the course of my field.

00:04:13:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:13:020000.Dialogue: Mm-hmm. Mm-hmm. Ooh, 101! Air's getting a bit thin up here.

00:04:20:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:20:060000.Dialogue: So, are we ready to order?

00:04:22:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:04:22:110000.Dialogue: Give me a minute. I'm gonna go wash up.

00:04:26:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:26:210000.Dialogue: Well, that's odd. We both washed up when we came in. It's probably a euphemism for urination.

00:04:34:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:34:030000.Dialogue: Sheldon, what is wrong with you?

00:04:36:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:36:110000.Dialogue: Not much. Although, I can be faulted for being overly fond of koala bears. I don't know what it is, when they smart munching on eucalyptus, I just melt inside.

00:04:47:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:47:220000.Dialogue: Okay, Amy just told you some exciting news, and you acted like it was no big deal.

00:04:52:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:52:010000.Dialogue: Oh, I see why you're confused. No, her news sounded important, but what you're forgetting is, it was an achievement in the field of biology. That's all about yucky, squishy things.

00:05:03:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:03:120000.Dialogue: Honey, she's upset. You're her boyfriend. You have to at least try to be excited by the things she's excited by.

00:05:10:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:10:060000.Dialogue: What if they simply don't excite me?

00:05:12:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:12:190000.Dialogue: Well, just smile and think about koalas.

00:05:16:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:16:020000.Dialogue: She'd see right through that. We go to the zoo all the time. She knows my koala face.

00:05:22:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:22:200000.Dialogue: And for future reference, it's this.

00:05:29:230000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:29:230000.Dialogue: Oh, you have a lot of magic stuff.

00:05:32:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:32:030000.Dialogue: Yeah. I started when I was a teenager. I thought I could show a girl a few tricks and invite her up to my bedroom to see the rest of the act.

00:05:43:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:43:190000.Dialogue: Ah, let's just say the only wand that ever saw any action was this one.

00:05:51:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:51:190000.Dialogue: Oh, look what my mom made us for the act.

00:05:55:150000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:55:150000.Dialogue: Ooh... I like the fabric. Where'd she get it?

00:06:00:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:00:040000.Dialogue: Well, she cut up one of her old bathing suits.

00:06:05:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:05:050000.Dialogue: She made these two vests and half a dozen napkins.

00:06:10:040000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:06:10:040000.Dialogue: Has she tried on the vest yet?!

00:06:13:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:13:170000.Dialogue: I just gave it to her!

00:06:14:170000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:06:14:170000.Dialogue: I hope it fits-- she has a tricky figure! She's short and stacked, like me!

00:06:22:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:22:210000.Dialogue: She's not stacked like you, Ma! She never steps on hers!

00:06:30:100000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:06:30:100000.Dialogue: Listen, Howie, maybe I'm not the best choice to be a magician's assistant.

00:06:34:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:34:230000.Dialogue: You'll do fine. Hand me those rings? See? You nailed it.

00:06:41:020000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:06:41:020000.Dialogue: You know, i-it's just that I'm not that comfortable with little kids.

00:06:44:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:44:070000.Dialogue: Well, that's because you haven't been around them much. This is good practice. I mean, you are gonna be a mom someday, right?

00:06:51:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:51:230000.Dialogue: Oh-ho-ho! I haven't seen this trick in years. It's called the dove pan. You let everyone see the pan is empty, but there's a secret compartment in the lid. And then you open it and produce a live...

00:07:27:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:27:000000.Dialogue: Oh, a little Red Dead Redemption, huh?

00:07:31:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:31:220000.Dialogue: How come you're not doing a mission? You're just wandering around.

00:07:34:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:34:140000.Dialogue: Had a rough night. I thought I'd go for a walk and clear my head.

00:07:41:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:41:190000.Dialogue: Some people go outside and do that.

00:07:45:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:45:110000.Dialogue: It's after 9:00-- at this hour the streets of Pasadena are teeming with drunken sailors and alley cats.

00:07:53:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:53:020000.Dialogue: You want to talk about it?

00:07:54:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:54:220000.Dialogue: No. I think I'll just go in this saloon and drink my troubles away.

00:08:05:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:05:140000.Dialogue: You know digital alcohol is never a solution.

00:08:13:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:13:070000.Dialogue: Hard as this may be to believe, it's possible that I'm not boyfriend material.

00:08:22:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:22:190000.Dialogue: Glad I was sitting down for that.

00:08:26:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:26:040000.Dialogue: Did you and Amy get in a fight?

00:08:28:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:28:050000.Dialogue: Amy had a fight; I was being perfectly reasonable.

00:08:33:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:33:010000.Dialogue: I'm gonna have a whiskey. Do you want anything?

00:08:35:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:35:080000.Dialogue: No, I can't. I'm playing Grand Theft Auto later.

00:08:45:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:45:120000.Dialogue: Look, I'm no expert in women...

00:08:50:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:50:070000.Dialogue: That's not necessary when someone's trying to help you.

00:08:53:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:53:010000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. It's the alcohol talking.

00:08:58:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:58:200000.Dialogue: Sometimes with women you want to listen to what upsets them and then show them that you can grow and change.

00:09:08:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:08:090000.Dialogue: Nuts to that. What else you got?

00:09:19:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:19:160000.Dialogue: Well, you skip over any attempt to repair your emotional connection and you win back her affection with an empty financial gesture.

00:09:30:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:30:020000.Dialogue: Well, that approach has Sheldon Cooper written all over it.

00:09:37:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:37:220000.Dialogue: It's appreciated. And if you ever manage to find a woman again, I'll be glad to return the favor.

00:09:45:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:45:120000.Dialogue: And now, all the rings are magically linked together.

00:09:52:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:52:070000.Dialogue: My fianc\E9e's wearing a magic ring, too. It made all my money disappear.

00:10:06:200000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:10:06:200000.Dialogue: And now, the great Howdini's next miraculous illusion.

00:10:12:150000.Speaker: Child
00:10:12:150000.Dialogue: When are we gonna have cake?

00:10:21:220000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:10:21:220000.Dialogue: Well, you're not getting cake right now, capisce?

00:10:30:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:30:150000.Dialogue: Now, my lovely assistant is going to bring me an ordinary pitcher of milk.

00:10:36:090000.Speaker: Second child
00:10:36:090000.Dialogue: I know how you do that trick.

00:10:38:040000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:10:38:040000.Dialogue: Do you know how to pipe down?

00:10:41:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:41:060000.Dialogue: Okay, we're going to roll up this newspaper.

00:10:48:000000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:10:48:000000.Dialogue: You got wax in your ears? The man said it's an ordinary pitcher.

00:10:55:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:55:040000.Dialogue: Okay, we're going to stick this in here. And then I'm going to pour in the milk. I hope this works, because I didn't bring a change of pants.

00:11:07:210000.Speaker: Second child
00:11:07:210000.Dialogue: Look, I Googled it. It's a fake pitcher.

00:11:13:030000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:11:13:030000.Dialogue: That's it. No cake for you. Anyone else want to join the No Cake Club?

00:11:19:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:19:210000.Dialogue: She's just kidding, boys and girls. Everyone gets cake.

00:11:28:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:28:020000.Dialogue: Just give me the pitcher. Behold!

00:11:54:220000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:11:54:220000.Dialogue: I told you I'm not good with kids.

00:11:57:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:57:030000.Dialogue: Yes, you did. Oh, I think my crotch is starting to curdle.

00:12:02:200000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:12:02:200000.Dialogue: The thing is, my mother worked full-time. I had to take care of my brothers and sisters.

00:12:10:110000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:12:10:110000.Dialogue: Ugh, it was horrible! With their snotty noses and their poopy diapers and their little shrieky voices, always complaining. I don't want to get dressed. Joey keeps spitting in my mouth. This isn't the way Mom makes waffles. Well, okay, put your hand in here. Let's see how you like this waffle!

00:12:27:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:27:040000.Dialogue: All right, settle down. Red light. Red light, red light!

00:12:36:200000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:12:36:200000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. I know it makes me sound like a bad person, but I just don't like children.

00:12:41:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:41:230000.Dialogue: Yeah, no, we all got that.

00:12:46:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:46:080000.Dialogue: But don't you think it'll be different when the child is ours?

00:12:50:170000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:12:50:170000.Dialogue: Right, when it's our kid that's ruined my body and kept me up all night and I've got no career and no future and nothing to be happy about for the next 20 years, sure, that'll be completely different.

00:13:11:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:11:100000.Dialogue: I don't think there's anything in this jewelry store that Amy would appreciate more than the humidifier we were just looking at at Sears.

00:13:19:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:19:110000.Dialogue: Oh, my God, now I know what I sound like to you when I say stupid stuff.

00:13:28:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:28:220000.Dialogue: Okay, I don't think Amy wants a pocket watch.

00:13:30:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:30:220000.Dialogue: No, but maybe she wants a man with a pocket watch.

00:13:41:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:41:200000.Dialogue: Well, she's very fond of her silver one that says allergic to penicillin.

00:13:46:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:46:010000.Dialogue: Maybe they have a dressier version of that?

00:13:49:110000.Speaker: Assistant
00:13:49:110000.Dialogue: Well, how are we doing this afternoon? Are we looking for anything special? Perhaps a ring for the lady?

00:13:54:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:54:070000.Dialogue: Trust me, we are not a couple.

00:13:56:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:56:150000.Dialogue: Excuse me. I don't see why you get to snort derisively and point that out. You'd be lucky to land a fella like me.

00:14:05:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:05:200000.Dialogue: Trust me, we are not a couple.

00:14:09:140000.Speaker: Assistant
00:14:09:140000.Dialogue: My apologies. How can I help you today?

00:14:12:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:12:070000.Dialogue: He's in trouble with his girlfriend and needs to buy her a present.

00:14:15:050000.Speaker: Assistant
00:14:15:050000.Dialogue: Great, trouble with girlfriends is what's putting my daughter through USC.

00:14:25:130000.Speaker: Assistant
00:14:25:130000.Dialogue: Yes. Channel set baguettes, 20 points total weight.

00:14:29:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:29:010000.Dialogue: Remarkable. Diamonds, crystallized carbon. Every day, people go to the grocery store and come home with sacks full of carbon in the form of charcoal briquettes that they toss in their barbeques and set on fire. But just because you've got some carbon with the atoms stacked neatly, you expect me to plunk down thousands of dollars.

00:14:48:160000.Speaker: Assistant
00:14:48:160000.Dialogue: Actually, that's only 750. Everything's on sale.

00:14:51:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:51:130000.Dialogue: Really. Talk to me about that pocket watch.

00:14:57:050000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Donkey Kong Jenga.
00:14:57:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:57:050000.Dialogue: I'm still trying to wrap my mind around it. I always thought I'd be a dad someday.

00:15:04:090000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Donkey Kong Jenga.
00:15:04:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:04:090000.Dialogue: Oh, me, too. You're so caring. I've often pictured you guiding a young boy into manhood.

00:15:14:170000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Donkey Kong Jenga.
00:15:14:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:14:170000.Dialogue: There you go, Howard. Sounds like Raj'll have your babies; problem solved.

00:15:19:090000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Donkey Kong Jenga.
00:15:19:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:19:090000.Dialogue: Hey, just because a man shows caring for another man doesn't mean he's displaying the love that dare not speak its name.

00:15:27:230000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Donkey Kong Jenga.
00:15:27:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:27:230000.Dialogue: Did she definitely say she didn't want kids?

00:15:29:200000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Donkey Kong Jenga.
00:15:29:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:29:200000.Dialogue: Yeah, she doesn't like them. And from what I saw, the feeling was mutual.

00:15:39:230000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Donkey Kong Jenga.
00:15:39:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:41:210000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Donkey Kong Jenga.
00:15:41:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:41:210000.Dialogue: I don't know. I can't see a life where I don't have kids. I mean, people have kids. I mean, even Donkey Kong had Donkey Kong Jr.

00:15:52:090000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Donkey Kong Jenga.
00:15:52:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:52:090000.Dialogue: So he could teach someone how to kidnap princesses and throw barrels at Italian plumbers.

00:16:00:150000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Donkey Kong Jenga.
00:16:00:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:00:150000.Dialogue: You know, there's no guarantee even if you have kids that you're going to like them.

00:16:05:220000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Donkey Kong Jenga.
00:16:05:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:05:220000.Dialogue: Wow, that's rough. Where'd you get that?

00:16:09:010000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Donkey Kong Jenga.
00:16:09:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:09:010000.Dialogue: It's right off the dust jacket of my mom's last book.

00:16:15:120000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Donkey Kong Jenga.
00:16:15:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:15:120000.Dialogue: Maybe me and Bernadette aren't right for each other.

00:16:19:200000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Donkey Kong Jenga.
00:16:19:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:19:200000.Dialogue: Look, Howard, I'd say there's a lot of fish in the sea, but I watched you dangle your hook in the water for years. Do not throw her back.

00:16:32:050000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Donkey Kong Jenga.
00:16:32:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:32:050000.Dialogue: I don't want to, but this is kind of a deal breaker.

00:16:36:090000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Donkey Kong Jenga.
00:16:36:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:36:090000.Dialogue: What's your mom going to say if you call off the wedding?

00:16:38:130000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Donkey Kong Jenga.
00:16:38:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:38:130000.Dialogue: Oh, it'll kill her. On the other hand, if I don't give her grandchildren, that'll kill her, too. So, either way, on the Mom front, I'm golden.

00:16:48:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:48:120000.Dialogue: What time did you tell Amy to be here?

00:16:57:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:57:110000.Dialogue: Sheldon, that pocket watch is ridiculous.

00:17:00:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:00:060000.Dialogue: Nonsense. I look like a train conductor.

00:17:05:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:05:230000.Dialogue: Under what pretext did you lure her here?

00:17:09:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:09:040000.Dialogue: I said, Hey, want to come over and hang out?

00:17:12:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:12:080000.Dialogue: Good, good, if you had said something clever, she might've gotten suspicious.

00:17:20:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:20:230000.Dialogue: Okay, he wants to talk to you.

00:17:22:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:22:160000.Dialogue: Well, I don't want to talk to him. And I'm pretty disappointed in you, too. Although we both know that won't last.

00:17:32:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:32:180000.Dialogue: Thank you. Amy, I'd like to apologize. Your accomplishment was impressive. And I'm proud of you.

00:17:45:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:45:010000.Dialogue: We both know that's your koala face.

00:17:49:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:49:110000.Dialogue: Okay, look, he bought you this.

00:17:51:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:51:150000.Dialogue: Jewelry? Seriously? Sheldon, you are the most shallow, self-centered person I have ever met. Do you really think another transparently manipul... Oh, it's a tiara!

00:18:03:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:03:120000.Dialogue: A tiara! I have a tiara! Put it on me, put it on me, put it on me, put it on me, put it on me, put it on me, put it on me.

00:18:15:060000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:15:060000.Dialogue: Of course I do, I'm a princess, and this is my tiara!

00:18:27:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:27:050000.Dialogue: You were right, the tiara was too much.

00:18:35:220000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:18:35:220000.Dialogue: Howard! Bernadette's... Oh, she slipped right by me.

00:18:43:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:43:230000.Dialogue: You should keep it. You could wear it again sometime.

00:18:51:230000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:18:51:230000.Dialogue: Don't forget to talk to her about this mishegas where I don't get grandkids!

00:18:59:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:59:070000.Dialogue: Don't worry, Ma. I will, as soon as I can figure out a way to bring up such a sensitive issue!

00:19:08:060000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:08:060000.Dialogue: I guess you talked to your mom, huh?

00:19:10:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:10:230000.Dialogue: I was upset. My mom can be a pretty good shoulder to cry on, if the smell of Bengay doesn't burn your eyes.

00:19:18:180000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:18:180000.Dialogue: Look, it's obvious having kids is really important to you, and I think I came up with a solution.

00:19:28:140000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:28:140000.Dialogue: Well, seeing as how I make way more money than you anyway, what if I work and you stay home with the kids?

00:19:58:210000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:58:210000.Dialogue: You know, I don't know if this counted as a fight, but how about some make-up sex?

00:20:04:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:20:04:230000.Dialogue: I would love that. But what is that behind your ear? Oh, look, it's a condom.
